title: TP-Link TL-WR940N httpd Improper Access Control Information Disclosure Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected installations of TP-Link TL-WR940N routers. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the httpd service, which listens on TCP port 80 by default. The issue results from the lack of proper access control. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to disclose stored credentials, leading to further compromise.
timeline:
2021-10-21 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2022-02-22 - Coordinated public release of advisory
